name: Adamic Covenant
description: Dominion mandate + prohibition. God's first arrangement with humanity.

name: Noahic Covenant
description: Universal covenant — rainbow sign. Never again destroy by flood.

name: Abrahamic Covenant
description: Land, seed, blessing — unconditional. Smoking firepot ratification.

name: Covenant of Circumcision
description: Sign of the covenant given to Abraham.

name: Covenant Confirmed to Isaac
description: God reaffirms Abrahamic promises to Isaac.

name: Covenant Confirmed to Jacob
description: Bethel vision — promises renewed to Jacob.

name: Mosaic Covenant (Sinai)
description: Conditional/bilateral — law, sacrificial system, priesthood.

name: Covenant Renewal (Moab)
description: Moses renews the covenant before entering the land.

name: Covenant at Shechem
description: Joshua's "choose this day" renewal.

name: Phinehas / Priestly Covenant
description: Perpetual priesthood promised to Phinehas' line.

name: Davidic Covenant
description: Eternal throne promise — unconditional.

name: Solomon's Temple Dedication
description: Covenant prayers at dedication of the First Temple.

name: Covenant Broken (Northern Kingdom)
description: Progressive covenant unfaithfulness leading to exile.

name: Josiah's Covenant Renewal
description: Discovery of law book, public renewal.

name: New Covenant Prophesied
description: "Written on their hearts" — the ultimate covenant promise.

name: Ezekiel's Covenant of Peace
description: Everlasting covenant with restored Israel.

name: Post-Exile Covenant Renewal
description: Ezra/Nehemiah lead public confession and covenant signing.

name: Eden — The First Land
description: God places humanity in a garden-home.

name: Exile from Eden
description: First land loss — driven out.

name: Land Promise to Abraham
description: "To your offspring I give this land" — from Nile to Euphrates.

name: Patriarchs Sojourn in Canaan
description: Abraham/Isaac/Jacob as strangers in the promised land.

name: Sojourn in Egypt
description: ~430 years away from the promised land.

name: Wilderness — At the Doorstep
description: 40 years — so close yet barred by unbelief.

name: Conquest of the Land
description: Joshua leads Israel into possession.

name: Division / Tribal Allotments
description: 12 tribes receive their inheritance.

name: Incomplete Possession (Judges)
description: Tribes fail to drive out inhabitants — land insecure.

name: Full Possession (United Kingdom)
description: David/Solomon — greatest territorial extent, "from Dan to Beersheba."

name: Land Divided
description: North/South split.

name: Northern Land Lost
description: Assyria deports Israel, resettles foreigners.

name: Southern Land Lost
description: Jerusalem destroyed, Judah exiled.

name: Exile — Landless
description: "By the rivers of Babylon we wept."

name: Return to the Land
description: Cyrus decree — remnant returns.

name: Land Under Foreign Rule
description: Back in the land but not sovereign — Persian rule.

name: God as King (Theocracy)
description: God rules directly — no human king needed.

name: Israel Demands a King
description: "Give us a king like the nations" — rejection of God's direct rule.

name: Saul Anointed
description: First king — chosen by God through Samuel.

name: Saul Rejected
description: "The LORD has torn the kingdom from you."

name: David Anointed
description: Shepherd boy secretly anointed — God's chosen king.

name: United Kingdom
description: Saul → David → Solomon — the monarchy's rise and peak.

name: Davidic Covenant
description: "Your throne shall be established forever."

name: Kingdom Divides
description: Rehoboam's folly splits the kingdom.

name: Northern Kingdom (Israel)
description: 19 kings — all evil, 9 dynasties, ends in Assyrian exile.

name: Southern Kingdom (Judah)
description: 20 kings — Davidic line preserved, some good kings.

name: End of Northern Kings
description: Hoshea — last king of Israel.

name: End of Davidic Throne
description: Zedekiah blinded — no Davidic king on earth's throne.

name: No King — Exile
description: Kingless period — only prophetic hope remains.

name: Zerubbabel — Davidic Heir
description: Davidic descendant leads return but is NOT crowned king.

name: Prophetic Hope: Future King
description: Prophets look forward to the ultimate Davidic king.

name: Protoevangelium — Seed of the Woman
description: First messianic promise: "He will crush your head."

name: Seed of Abraham
description: "Through your offspring all nations will be blessed."

name: Scepter of Judah
description: "The scepter shall not depart from Judah" — Jacob's prophecy.

name: Star of Jacob
description: Balaam's prophecy: "A star will come out of Jacob."

name: Prophet Like Moses
description: "The LORD will raise up a prophet like me."

name: Kinsman-Redeemer (Boaz)
description: Boaz as type of Christ — redeems Ruth/Naomi.

name: Davidic Covenant
description: Eternal throne = eternal King to come.

name: Royal/Messianic Psalms
description: David's psalms describe a coming divine king/priest.

name: Immanuel — Virgin Birth
description: "A virgin shall conceive and bear a son."

name: Prince of Peace
description: "Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father."

name: Root of Jesse
description: "A shoot from the stump of Jesse" — Davidic restoration.

name: Suffering Servant
description: He was "pierced for our transgressions."

name: Born in Bethlehem
description: "Out of you will come a ruler over Israel."

name: Righteous Branch
description: "A King who will reign wisely" — from David's line.

name: New Covenant
description: The Messiah's covenant — written on hearts.

name: Son of Man
description: "Given dominion, glory, and a kingdom" — heavenly ruler.

name: Humble King on a Donkey
description: "Your king comes to you, gentle and riding on a donkey."

name: Pierced One
description: "They will look on me, the one they have pierced."

name: Messenger of the Covenant
description: "I will send my messenger" — last OT messianic word.
